sen.j: 平 経盛（たいら の つねもり、天治元年（1124年） - 文治元年3月24日 (旧暦)（1185年4月25日））は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tsunemori [1124 - March 24, 1185 on lunar calendar (April 25)] was a warlord in the late Heian era.
TAIRA no Tsunemori [1124 - March 24, 1185 according to the lunar calendar (April 25)] was a warlord in the late Heian era.
TAIRA no Tsunemori (1124 - May 2, 1185) was a warlord in the late Heian era.
sen.cmt: 日付訂正しました、新暦のみ表記。グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.e: He was the third son of TAIRA no Tadamori.
He was the third son of TAIRA no Tadamori.
He was the third son of TAIRA no Tadamori.
He was the younger half brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was a younger half-brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was a younger half-brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.

sen.j: 母は陸奥守・源信雅の女。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of MINAMOTO no Nobumasa who was governor of Mutsu.
His mother was a daughter of MINAMOTO no Nobumasa, who was governor of Mutsu Province.
His mother was a daughter of MINAMOTO no Nobumasa, who was governor of Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 子に平経正・平経俊・平敦盛らがいる。
sen.e: His sons were TAIRA no Tsunemasa, TAIRA no Tsunetoshi and TAIRA no Atsumori.
His sons were TAIRA no Tsunemasa, TAIRA no Tsunetoshi, and TAIRA no Atsumori.
His sons were TAIRA no Tsunemasa, TAIRA no Tsunetoshi, and TAIRA no Atsumori.

sen.j: 異母弟の平教盛・平頼盛に比べると官位の昇進が遅く政治的活動もほとんど見出せないが、忠盛から歌人的側面を受け継いだ。
sen.e: Comparing to his half brothers such as TAIRA no Norimori and TAIRA no Yorimori, his promotion was slower than others and he didn't do any political performances, however, he took over the talent as poet from Tadamori.

in comparison to his half-brothers, such as TAIRA no Norimori and TAIRA no Yorimori, he was slow to be promoted, and didn't achieve any noteworthy accomplishments in the political arena; however, he was recognized as having the same talent for poetry as his father, tadamori.

In comparison to his half-brothers, such as TAIRA no Norimori and TAIRA no Yorimori, he was slow to be promoted, and didn't achieve any noteworthy accomplishments in the political arena; however, he was recognized as having the same talent for poetry as his father, Tadamori.
sen.cmt: In大文字にしました。Tadamori大文字にしました。

sen.j: 守覚法親王の仁和寺歌会や二条天皇の内裏歌会などに出席し、自らも歌合を催している。
sen.e: Joining the poetry party at Ninna-ji Temple which was held by Imperial Prince Shukaku and the poetry party at imperial palace held by Emperor Nijo, he also held his own poetry party.
He attended a poetry party held at Ninna-ji Temple, which was held by Prince Shukaku, as well as a poetry party at the Imperial palace held by Emperor Nijo, and he also held his own poetry party.

He attended a poetry party held at Ninna-ji Temple, which was held by Cloistered Imperial Prince Shukaku, as well as a poetry party at the Imperial Palace held by Emperor Nijo, and he also held his own poetry party.
sen.cmt: 守覚法親王→Cloistered Imperial Prince ShukakuPalace大文字にしました。

sen.j: 太皇太后・藤原多子の職事を長年に渡って務めた関係から、歌壇の中心である徳大寺家の徳大寺実定・実家（多子の兄弟）、女流歌人・小侍従局（多子の女房）、六条藤家の藤原清輔（太皇太后宮職における上司）・藤原重家 (刑部卿)と親密な交流があった。
sen.e: As he had served for Grand Empress Dowager FUJIWARA no Tashi in the imperial household agency for long years, he had close relationships with the main members of poetry circles such as Sanesada and Saneie TOKUDAIJI brothers (Tashi's brothers), Kojiju no tsubone (Tashi's maid), FUJIWARA no Kiyosuke from the Rokujo Toke family (Tunemori's boss in the imperial household agency), and FUJIWARA no Shigeie (Lord of Justice).

As he had been in the service of the Dowager Empress, FUJIWARA no Tashi, in the Imperial household agency for many years, he had established a close relationships with the main members of the poetry circles, including the TOKUDAIJI brothers, Sanesada and Saneie (Tashi's brothers), Kojiju no tsubone (Tashi's maid), FUJIWARA no Kiyosuke from the Rokujo Toke family (Tunemori's superior in the Imperial household agency), and FUJIWARA no Shigeie (the Lord of Justice).

As he had been in the service of the Dowager Empress, FUJIWARA no Tashi, in the Imperial household agency for many years, he had established a close relationships with the main members of the poetry circles, including the Tokudaiji brothers, Sanesada and Saneie (Tashi's brothers), Kojiju no tsubone (Tashi's maid), FUJIWARA no Kiyosuke from the Rokujo-Fujiwara family (Tunemori's superior in the Imperial household agency), and FUJIWARA no Shigeie (the Lord of Justice).
sen.cmt: Tokudaijiと訂正しました。the Rokujo-Fujiwara familyに訂正しました。

sen.j: 『新勅撰和歌集』以下の勅撰集に11首が入集する。
sen.e: 11 poems were selected in the imperial anthology of Japanese waka such as "Shin Chokusen Wakashu (New Imperial Collection)."
From his poems, eleven were selected for inclusion in various Imperial anthologies of waka popems, such as, "Shin Chokusen Wakashu (New Imperial Collection)."
From his poems, eleven were selected for inclusion in various Imperial anthologies of waka poems, such as, "Shin Chokusen Wakashu" (New Imperial Collection).
sen.cmt: poemsスペル訂正しました。"の位置訂正しました。

sen.e: His private collection was "Tsunemori shu."
There is a collection exclusively of his works entitled, "Collected Poems of Tsunemori."
There is a collection exclusively of his works entitled, "Collected Poems of Tsunemori."

sen.j: 元暦2年（1185年）3月、壇ノ浦の戦いに敗れ、弟の教盛とともに入水して果てた。
sen.e: In March, 1185, defeated in the naval battle of Dan-no-ura, Tsunemori committed a suicide by throwing himself into the sea with his younger brother Norimori.
In March 1185, having suffered defeated in the naval battle at Dan-no-ura, Tsunemori committed suicide, throwing himself into the sea along with his younger brother, Norimori.
In March 1185, having suffered defeated in the naval battle at Dannoura, Tsunemori committed suicide, throwing himself into the sea along with his younger brother, Norimori.

sen.j: 12月27日伊賀守（平治の乱の勲功）
sen.e: Appointed to Governor of Iga Province on December 27. (because of deed of valor in the Heiji Revolt.)
He was appointed as Governor of Iga Province on December 27. (In recognition of his valor in the Heiji Revolt.)
He was appointed as Governor of Iga Province on February 13, 1160. (In recognition of his valor in the Heiji Revolt.)

sen.j: 平治2年のち改元して永暦元年（1160年）（37歳）

sen.e: Conferred Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) on April 3. (Koka Moin, to be given.)
The court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was cnferred on him on April 3. (And he was awarded the Koka Moin.)
The court rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) was conferred on him on May 17. (And he was awarded the Kokamonin.)
sen.cmt: 新暦に訂正しました。conferredスペル訂正しました。Kokamoninに訂正しました。

sen.e: April 7, Taikotaigo gu gon no taishin (Third level official for Empress dowager) concurrently.

He was appointed to the post of Taikotaigo gu gon no taishin (Third level official for Empress dowager) on May 21, which he held concurrently with his other posts.

sen.j: 8月14日従四位下（上西門院御給）
